bioghist.p: DeBonsall Hedley (1911-1978) was married to Eva L. Hedley. He graduated from Westtown School in 1931. He lived in Wethersfield, Connecticut in the 1970s, then moved to Philadelphia. He had also previously lived in West Chester, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains genealogical research materials and other items reflecting Hedley's interests. Genealogical materials include: annual reports, minutes, and membership lists for the Society of the Descendants of the Founders of Hartford; handwritten notes, photostats and other copies related to research on royal and biblical figure genealogies; lists, pedigree charts and other information related to the exchange of ancestral surnames; printed materials related to the Connecticut Society of Genealogists; and some information related to the holdings of the Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania. Other materials include: Hedley's Westtown School yearbook from 1931, which includes felt letters, clippings, and signatures from some classmates; research on "migrant races", including a sample chapter for a proposed book, correspondence, handwritten notes, and a telegram from Dwight D. Eisenhower; newspaper articles on World War I and World War II; issues of Spot Lite, the newsletter of the Riegel Paper Corporation, 1938-1939, which include information on recreational and community activities and drawings; Baedeker's London and Surroundings and some printed materials from the U.S. Department of State about various European countries; and miscellaneous printed materials and artifacts. There are also several albums/commonplace books with illustrations and poems copied in. One is supposedly a diary of Anna Humphreys Garrigues.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
